page.title: 11HELSBY STATION
page.content: Helsby Station is over lOO years old having opened on 22nd June l865. It is the junction between two railway lines, the Chester to Manchester line and a line to Liverpool. Thus you can travel from Helsby to Liverpool via the underground and you can travel to North Wales via Chester. In the opposite direction you can go to Warrington via Frodsham and then on to Manchester. Each day 8O trains pass through Helsby without stopping - these are both passenger and freight. 5O trains stop daily at Helsby Station. The busiest time of the day is between 7 a.m. and 9 a.m. and 4.3O p.m. and 6.3O p.m. In a normal week between 6OO to 7OO people use Helsby Station. Although the signal box is always mannedd the booking office is only manned between 6a.m. to lO p.m. from Monday to Saturday.
